title: [Large-scale] Collaborative Learning Program for Customized Diabetes Educator Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic diabetes concepts and foundational teaching experience
context.additional_context: Hybrid environment combining smartphone-based mobile learning and in-person workshops, operating during weekends/evenings for working professionals

learning_goals: Cultivation of the ability to design personalized blood glucose management education programs reflecting learners' cultural and individual backgrounds
Development of strategies to enhance diabetic patients' self-efficacy through collaborative goal setting

Learners analyze three vocational training institution case studies (digital literacy, welding skills, elder care) under a 1 million KRW budget and 4-week time constraint. Applying a five-step problem-solving framework (problem definition-cause analysis-solution generation-action plan-evaluation), they create an operational plan including a budget allocation table (within 10% error per item) and a 4-week schedule. The plan must score 12+ points (out of 15) on the institution's evaluation rubric (clarity, feasibility, budget efficiency).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
